However, because there is no wedding, they can't get the baby trust fund. Maxine begs Douglas to marry Mitzi to get the money, but he refuses.
Maxine and Robert Get Married
When Norma returns to Palm Beach for Mitzi and Douglas' wedding, she ends up asking Maxine for forgiveness.
Robert, who reunited with his son Rafael, hoped to get custody but wasn't able because he's not married.

In an unexpected turn of events, Maxine tells Robert that she will marry him so that he can have custody of his son. He says that he doesn’t have a ring and Norma offers up her own. Norma says she wanted to give it to her daughter Penelope, AKA Linda, but gives it to Maxine.
As the ceremony takes place, Norma sings “Something Good” from “The Sound of Music.” She then disappears.
Evelyn and Eddie Break Up
Eddie becomes insecure with his and Evelyn's relationship after she cheats on him with Jed. Evelyn realizes that Eddie might have feelings for Mitzi and tells him that she wants her “independence.”
Perry Becomes Mayor of Palm Beach Thanks to Dinah
Dinah gives the coveted imperial egg that Marjorie Merriweather Post has been wanting in exchange for making Perry the next mayor of Palm Beach.
Finally pleased to have the object in her possession, Marjorie uses her power and influence to make it happen.
Robert’s Son Is Not Who We Think He Is

After Maxine and Robert get married, she realizes that since Robert was adopted by Norma and an official Dellacorte, and he was in a legitimate marriage when he had Rafi, it would unlock the baby trust.

He says that he was married to Rafi's mother when he was born, so technically the baby trust money should be his. The end shows Robert and Maxine sharing the wealth of their Dellacorte fortune with Mitzi after she gives birth to her baby. The new mom is also seen with Eddie.
When it all seems to be happily ever after for everyone, one final scene shows Rafi sitting in a dark office and on the phone. He tells the person on the other line, “They bought it. I’m in.”
What does this mean? Is he not really Robert's son?
Norma and Linda/Penelope Reunite
Linda is seen in Paris. In a letter to Maxine, she thanks her for wiring her “a hefty chunk of the baby money” so that she can be free.
As she explores the city, she sees Norma sitting at an outdoor table with a martini. It zooms in on Norma, who adoringly looks at her daughter and the two reunite.
Will There Be a Season 3 of 'Palm Royale'?
Maxine and Evelyn get to reopen the Palm Royale and take over Palm Beach. But will they encounter any more trouble?
At this time, “Palm Royale” has not been renewed for a third season.
In an interview with Collider, Ricky Martin hoped that Robert’s story would continue.
“I have the need to say I hope we have Season 3 so we can just really show off,” he said, laughing and adding, “Did I just say that?”

title: Connor Storrie Says 'Heated Rivalry' Season 2 Will Likely Film This Summer
summary: The already renewed Season 2 of “Heated Rivalry” can’t come soon enough — and actor Connor Storrie shared an update exclusively on TODAY
story: The already renewed Season 2 of “Heated Rivalry” can’t come soon enough — and actor Connor Storrie shared an update exclusively on TODAY.

The six-episode romance drama, based on the 2019 book of the same name by Rachel Reid, follows the love story between hockey rivals Ilya Rozanov (Storrie) and Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams). After just the fourth episode aired on Crave on Canada and HBO Max in the U.S., the show was renewed for a second season.
In his morning TV show debut on Jan. 14, Storrie said on TODAY that it should be a "Heated" summer in 2026 when filming for the next season gets underway.
Live updates: Follow our live blog as Connor Storrie makes his morning TV debut on TODAY
"I think Jacob's still writing it," he told Craig Melvin, referencing writer and director Jacob Tierney. "I think we're going to be filming, I don't know when, exactly."
Craig asked if "soon" meant as early as this summer.
"Yeah, I think about then," Storrie said.

“Heated Rivalry” premiered Nov. 28 and aired its finale about one month later. Conversations about the show continue to dominate social media, and when Williams and Storrie made their respective late night debuts on “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” and “Late Night with Seth Meyers,” crowds swarmed 30 Rock.
During his appearance on “The Tonight Show,” Williams also teased Season 2 of the hockey romance drama.
“There are some big baddies,” he told Fallon. “If Season 1 is like an internal battle, Season 2 is more of an external battle.”

In Reid’s “Game Changers” book series, Shane and Ilya’s story picks up again after “Heated Rivalry” with a sequel, titled “The Long Game.” This book follows their respective pro hockey careers as they continue to keep their relationship a secret. (Just days before Storrie’s TODAY appearance, Reid announced she will release a third book about Shane and Ilya, titled “Unrivaled,” due out in September.)
Tierney has confirmed that Season 2 will continue Shane and Ilya’s story. In a video announcing Season 2, Storrie notably told viewers, “Start reading ‘The Long Game’ if you want spoilers.”

title: Kiefer Sutherland Arrested Following Altercation With Ride-Share Driver
summary: Actor Kiefer Sutherland was arrested Monday, Jan. 12 following an alleged altercation with a ride-share driver, NBC News confirmed.
story: Actor Kiefer Sutherland was arrested Monday, Jan. 12 following an alleged altercation with a ride-share driver, NBC News confirmed.

Shortly after midnight on the morning of Jan. 12, officers from the Los Angeles Police Department responded to a call about an assault involving the 59-year-old actor and the driver, NBC4 Investigates first reported and a LAPD spokesperson confirmed to NBC News.
Upon further investigation, officers determined that Sutherland got in the car, “physically assaulted the driver (the victim), and made criminal threats toward” them, the LAPD said.
The unidentified victim did not sustain any injuries requiring medical treatment at the scene, LAPD added.

The “Designated Survivor” star was arrested at the scene for criminal threats. He was booked on suspicion of committing a felony, the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s website shows. He was released on bond a few hours later. His bond was set for $50,000.
Detectives from the Hollywood Division are investigating the incident.
The records show his court date for the case has been set for Feb. 2.
Sutherland’s agent and rep did not immediately respond to NBC News’ request for comment.

title: Henry Winkler's Spirit Tunnel Dance Moves Will Make Your Day
summary: Henry Winkler is in the running for one of the top spirit tunnel entrances of all time.
story: Henry Winkler is in the running for one of the top spirit tunnel entrances of all time.

Most guests who appear on “The Jennifer Hudson Show” have the honor of showing off their dance moves in the famous spirit tunnel hallway backstage before making their way to the set. For the Monday, Jan. 12 episode, Winkler appeared on the show and delighted fans with his dance skills.

In a clip shared on the talk show’s Instagram account, the 80-year-old actor kicks and twirls around while “The Jennifer Hudson Show” employees clap and sing a version of Billy Joel’s hit “Uptown Girl,” with different lyrics expressing how happy they are to have him on the show again.
When he reaches the end of the tunnel, Winkler turns around and blows the employees a kiss and waves.
“We’re so happy @hwinkler4real is back!” the show captioned the post.
Fans in the comments praised Winkler’s dancing, with many referencing his iconic “Happy Days” character, The Fonz.
“I love him . He’s a stepper,” one wrote.
Another cheered, “The Fonz still got it! Heeeyyyyyyy.”
A third agreed, writing, “The Fonz is still making us smile.”
A couple Instagram users commented with gifs of Winkler busting a move as The Fonz on “Happy Days.”
While chatting with host Jennifer Hudson on the show, Winkler spoke about recently being inducted into the TV Hall of Fame.

“I got to be with such an incredible class of people. It was just amazing,” he said about the “big honor.” He also shared that he was so appreciative that Ryan Murphy, who gave a speech at the ceremony, mentioned his son Max Winkler. Max Winkler is a director and screenwriter who has worked with Murphy.
“I thought, ‘I no longer need the award. That was it,’” the proud dad gushed.

There have been countless celeb guests on “The Jennifer Hudson Show” over the years who have braved the spirit tunnel and left a lasting impact like Winkler. Last year, Aaron Pierre’s “That’s Mufasa” dance went viral.

In April 2025, comedian Bert Kreischer decided to put on a show for the employees and performed some Magic Mike quality movies while shirtless. The employees sang a version of Nelly’s “Hot in Herre” as the comedian danced.

title: Megan Thee Stallion Keeps Her Grandmother’s Recipes Close to Thee Chest
summary: Megan Thee Stallion wins Grammys, but is also a star in the kitchen. She shares what she likes to cook, but keeps her grandmother's recipes a secret.
story: Megan Thee Stallion raps in “Savage” that she’s “classy, bougie, ratchet,” but at home, she’s also gourmet.
“You would not think that people are walking around my house asking me to make them food, but that is definitely happening to me,” she says.

Speaking with TODAY.com in partnership with Dunkin’, the  three-time Grammy winner has risen from humble beginnings to the top of the music game with several No. 1 hits and an entire season in her musical chokehold, and she says her love of cooking is a big part of her offstage life.

“It’s something as basic as a breakfast sandwich,” she says, adding that her cooking often skews Southern due to her roots. “It’s just bread, scrambled eggs, turkey sausage, little hot sauce, little mayo, and I don’t know why it tastes so good.”
Megan says her go-to dishes include roast beef with potatoes (which she says she’s “figuring out” the ideal recipe for), oxtails and spaghetti.
The latter is documented in an August 2025 TikTok in which she prepares pasta with catfish, a Southern delicacy, for boyfriend Klay Thompson, who she says asks for it “like every week.”
“I’m getting in my bag. I’m getting in my wifely era,” she tells TODAY.com.
Indeed, the rapper cycles through several monikers like Tina Snow and H-town Hottie, but in her cooking videos, she’s the Hot Girl Chef.

She’s shared everything from a cooking tutorial on fried Hot Cheeto pickles to a cookbook-worthy Thanksgiving spread she prepared before meeting Thompson’s family, which included several sides, dressing, a brined and basted turkey and barbecue baked beans — a recipe she’s keeping close to the chest.

“I mean, I can’t just be giving out my secret recipes now. My grandma would in an uproar, OK?” she says, but offers a tidbit of info. “Just know that it’s packed with lots of meat, lots of vegetables.”
Megan is enjoying the release of her aerobics-inspired ad for Dunkin’ to launch Protein Milk and her own drink: Megan’s Mango Protein Refresher.
She says she’s not into “sugary drinks,” so the drink is subtly sweet with mango flavor mixed with Protein Milk, which pairs well with her smooth original track for the commercial.
“I had already been working on a song about working out and I didn’t know when I was gonna drop it,” she says, so she kept the track on ice for a while. Then Dunkin’ called.

“When the Dunkin’ collab came to me and they were like, ‘Oh yeah, and by the way, we need a song,’” Megan says. “I was like, ‘God, boom, I have it. I have the perfect home for this song.’ This is when opportunity just meets preparedness. So boom, here we go.”

While her composing and rapping prowess flows through the airwaves, her cooking acumen stays in her home kitchen at the moment. But, when asked, she said she is open to doing a culinary show — or a cooking segment on a certain morning TV show.
“I definitely would,” she says. “Hit me up.”

title: What Zodiac Signs Are 'The Traitors' Season 4 Cast? An Astrologer Breaks it Down
summary: What zodiac signs are the cast of The Traitors Season 4? Here's who is an Aries, Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Leo, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius and Pisces.
story: Some of our favorite reality stars, athletes, actors, and icons have come together to form the cast of Season 4 of "The Traitors."
The Peacock series, hosted by Alan Cumming (an Aquarius), premiered on January 8 and showcases celebrities such as Johnny Weir, Dorinda Medley, and Ron Funches, among others.

Looking at the cast, it’s important to note their zodiac signs to understand how they’ll interact and play together. There are no Leos or Capricorns, but plenty of mutable signs (Gemini, Virgo, Sagittarius, and Pisces) to stir the pot. With Episodes 1 to 3 already aired, we are seeing major drama unfold.
Read below to find out what zodiac sign is more likely to be a Traitor or Faithful.
Aries

Aries are driven to excel. Being that they are the first sign of the zodiac, they are full of bravado and gusto — so much so that the warrior sign won’t stop until they peak to great heights. Aries will never allow themselves to be the sacrificial ram, making them a force to be reckoned with. They are born to conquer!
Taurus

Tauruses are great at gathering background information on the contestants, much like Carolyn Stanbury stated in Episode 1 of Season 4. However, that does not mean they’re gossipy. The Bull likes to be in the know because it can manage the environment and be in tune with the energy that surrounds it without breaking a sweat, thereby defeating others.
Gemini

Geminis have a dualistic and duplicitous side to them, making them the perfect person to cause a ruckus on “The Traitors.“ The twin star might spill the tea, twist facts, and slip in some side eye to get their way — basically, the air sign will do anything to get their hands on the cash prize and the acclaim they crave.
Cancer

Cancers can be secretive at times, as their planetary ruler is the moon. Since their emotions change every few days from the lunar phases, they’re tricky to read. You never know what you’re going to get, which is why anyone who messes with a crab better watch out. Their pincers are no joke!
Virgo

Virgos are going to be methodical and authentic. Their approach to situations is based on what unfolds before their eyes. Then, they can assess and decide how they want to proceed, mindfully and cautiously. The earth sign may appear sweet and innocent, but its shadow side can be competitive and cutthroat — especially when it comes to money, acclaim and success.
Libra

Libras are fair-minded, meaning they will not veer from the rules unless they have to. While they put on a nice front, Libras can flirt with danger. If they are a Traitor or a Faithful, odds are that they’ll be diplomatic in how they move forward on the show. Throughout the process, they’ll have a smile on their faces.
Scorpio

Scorpio is a zodiac sign that knows how to plot and manipulate to get what they want and use information to their advantage. If anyone stands in their way, Scorpio’s stingers come out. Those who are born under this sign assert their power and control situations with their authoritative and intense presence. One could say they would make the best Traitor!
Sagittarius

The archer is the only constellation that is both a protector and warrior — anyone who acts against them will have to watch their back. Sagittarius likes to have the last word, which means they aren’t going anywhere without a fight or drama. The other contestants better beware! Lying might be hard, since they are known for their brutal honesty.
Aquarius

The air sign might play aloof, but they have their head in the game. Expect the Aquarian contestants to be low-key messy behind the scenes as they plot their strategy, but be nice to the faces of those who are their adversaries. They’ll use their intellect and mindfulness to secure the bag. Watch out, because you’ll never see them coming!
Pisces

Pisces is an intuitive sign that uses its sixth sense to rise above the rest. These players may have an inkling who their opponents are, but not proof. Plus, Pisces are great at deflecting energy. Their secretive nature allows them to trick others into trusting them, as they won’t reveal any clues. Pisces can win based on a hunch or vibe.
For what it's worth, last season's winners, a group of Faithfuls, were ccom

title: A Journalist Tried to Cheer Up an NFL Coach After His Team's Loss. Backlash Followed — So Did Praise
summary: Journalist Lynn Jones angered some people for saying kind words to Jacksonville Jaguars head coach Liam Coen after they lost in the NFL playoffs.
story: The Jacksonville Jaguars’ loss to the Buffalo Bills in the Wild Card round of the NFL playoffs on Jan. 11 came with plenty of on-field drama that turned into an off the field controversy after the game.
Lynn Jones, a journalist with the Jacksonville Free Press, rankled some feathers with comments she made during Jaguars head coach Liam Coen’s postgame press conference.

“I just want to tell you congratulations on your success, young man,” Jones told Coen. “You hold your head up, alright? You guys have had a most magnificent season. You did a great job out there today. So you just hold your head up, OK?”

“You keep it going. We got another season, OK? Take care and much continued success to you and the entire team,” she continued before the press conference proceeded with more questions from other reporters.
The interaction has become a flashpoint between those who feel Jones’ words were uplifting and those who say it’s not a reporter’s job to play cheerleader.
On X, veteran ESPN reporter Adam Schefter called it “an awesome post-game exchange,” while SNY reporter Ian Begley had some concerns.
“Very nice exchange. Wouldn’t call it an exchange between a reporter and the coach, though. Uplifting the head coach after a loss is not part of a sports reporter’s job,” he wrote.
“This is not awesome. This is called being a cheerleader. Reporters should be in PR if they want to carry on like this,” sportswriter Brandon Warne commented.
ESPN personality Pat McAfee, though, stood firmly with Jones.
“Love seeing these sports ‘journalists’ getting ABSOLUTELY BURIED for being curmudgeon bums,” he began a long X post defending her.
Jones’ comments may have sparked a conversation about whether a reporter can speak the way she, but she says they weren’t planned in advance.
“The words just came out,” she told The Washington Post. “I didn’t pre-think this. I didn’t know he was going to need to hold his head up until he came out.”
Jones said she was trying to highlight what the community was feeling.

“My question was, ‘Keep you head up, young man. Young man, this entire year we have rooted for this team over more than 30 years,’" she told Jacksonville TV station WJXT. "Do you understand what I was saying? This stadium, the solemness. I mean, it was packed.”
Jones also has no problem with the backlash she has received.
“I don’t take no offense to it,” she added when told about Long’s response to her. “Listen, I’ve been in this business more than 25 years.”

title: What Oprah Thinks About a Man Calling His Girlfriend His ‘Partner’
summary: Oprah Winfrey told TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle what she thinks about when a man refers to his girlfriend as his "partner."
story: Oprah Winfrey is all in on having a partner. Not a “girlfriend.” Not a “significant other.” A partner.

During her appearance on the Jan. 13 episode of TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle, Oprah chimed in with her take on a recent GQ article about men calling their girlfriends their “partner,” a title that was amplified when Timothée Chalamet referred to Kylie Jenner as such while accepting an award at the Critics Choice Awards. (He would do so again when he won best male actor in a motion picture — musical or comedy during last weekend’s Golden Globes.)

“You know why I like the word ‘partner’? Because it’s mature. It says that it’s a mature, it’s a stable relationship,” Oprah said. “It’s not just like ‘my girlfriend.’ ‘Cause you have a girlfriend when you’re 7, when you’re 10, when you’re 15. So ‘partner’ adds a level of maturity and responsibility.”
“So, if a guy says, ‘You know what? You’re my partner,’ that means ‘I’m riding with you.’ Like, ‘We’re in this,’” Sheinelle Jones added.
“That means, yes, we’re in it together. There’s a partnership. ... So I thought that was really good,” Oprah replied.
Oprah has referred to Stedman Graham as her partner for years, putting her at the forefront of this word choice.
“Before it was a thing, you were calling each other ‘partner,’” Sheinelle pointed out.
“Yes, we’ve always used the word ‘partner,’” Oprah said.
“Of course she started it. She started everything,” Jenna Bush Hager joked. “Oprah started the word ‘partner.’ How dare we!”
Oprah said it’s only natural to use partner, given the length of their relationship, too.
“After 20 years, you can’t say, ‘He’s my boyfriend.’ ... And, also, once you get to a certain age, ‘He’s my boyfriend’ — No! ‘Partner’ is a much better word,” she said.

title: BTS Is Back! How to Get Tickets to the 79-Show, 34-City World Tour
summary: BTS announced a worldwide tour for 2026-2027. Here's how to get tickets.
story: It's time, BTS ARMY.
BTS is coming to a stadium near you. The K-pop band announced a massive 11-month "BTS World Tour" on Jan. 13, spanning 79 shows in 34 different regions.
This tour will be one of the largest the group will complete to date and is one of the biggest global K-pop tours of all time.

Before the tour's kickoff in April, BTS will release their new album on March 20. Singing songs from their upcoming album and fan favorites, the tour will feature a 360-degree stadium stage production.
The tour marks their first performances as a group since the 2021-2022 "Permission to Dance on Stage" tour.

All seven members —RM, Jin, Suga, J-Hope, Jimin, V and Jung Kook — completed their South Korean military service in June 2025. Ever since, BTS fans, known as ARMY, have been awaiting their next performance.
When Does the 'BTS World Tour' Start?
BTS will kick off their first show on April 9 in Goyang, South Korea.
How to Get Tickets to the 'BTS World Tour'
Here’s what to know about ticket sales.

title: Oprah Winfrey Dealt With This 1 Side Effect While Taking a Weight Loss Drug
summary: Oprah Winfrey says she had one big main side effect from taking a GLP-1 weight-loss drug: constipation. She reveals the remedy that helps her stay regular.
story: Oprah Winfrey says she had one big main side effect from taking a GLP-1 weight-loss drug.
The most common problems for patients taking blockbuster anti-obesity medications like Wegovy and Zepbound are gastrointestinal issues including nausea, diarrhea and constipation.
"I never had nausea or diarrhea, but I did have the third one," Winfrey told TODAY’s Jenna Bush Hager and Sheinelle Jones during a live interview on Tuesday, Jan. 13.
"I finally figured out, for me, what the right combination of magnesium and water is. I have to drink a lot of water... I have to have a gallon of water a day."
Winfrey added that she has to drink all of that water before 4 p.m.; otherwise, she's up all night.
Water helps soften stool and move food through the intestines, easing constipation.
Magnesium citrate helps by causing stool to retain water, softening it, making it easier to pass and increasing the frequency of bowel movements, according to the National Library of Medicine.
Winfrey writes about finally finding weight-loss success with a GLP-1 drug in her new book, "Enough: Your Health, Your Weight, and What It’s Like to Be Free."
"Oprah's kidneys are very, very happy," said Dr. Ania Jastreboff, her co-author and an endocrinologist and associate professor at the Yale School of Medicine.
Every medicine for any disease has side effects, and there’s always a risk-to-benefit ratio to consider, Jastreboff added.
Hydration is also one of the best ways to lessen nausea, a side effect that can frustrate GLP-1 users, as is increasing the dose of the medication very slowly, she said.
"So start low, go slow. If you're feeling nauseated, then don't increase the dose," Jastreboff advised.
"And there's other things: Not eating past the point of fullness, making sure you're monitoring which foods could make you (feel) worse. All of these different things can lower the side effects."

title: Did Leonardo DiCaprio Really Say ‘Pasta, Pasta and More Pasta’ Was His Favorite Food in 1991?
summary: Leonard DiCaprio's Teen Beat questionnaire from 1991 was found online in all its glory after Nikki Glaser brought it up at the 2026 Golden Globes.
story: Nikki Glaser attained the impastable while hosting the Golden Globes: valuable information about a famously private actor.
On Jan. 11, the awards show brought Hollywood’s glitterati together to celebrate movies, television and, for the first time, podcasts.
Glaser used her monologue to playfully rib celebrities from The Rock to Nicole Kidman to Timothée Chalamet, before turning her focus to Leonardo DiCaprio.
“You’ve won three Golden Globes, an Oscar, and the most impressive thing is that you were able to accomplish all of that before your girlfriend turned 30,” Glaser joked.

“I’m sorry I made that joke. It’s cheap. You know what? I try not to but, like, we don’t know anything else about you, man, like there’s nothing, man,” Glaser said, adding that she searched high and low, but the “most in-depth interview” she could find was in Teen Beat magazine in 1991 — when the now-51-year-old actor was 17.
“Is your favorite food still ‘pasta, pasta and more pasta?’” she asked, and DiCaprio nodded to laughter from the crowd. “Look it up. That’s real.”
Well, the internet wasted no time in doing just that, and keyboard detectives dug up and posted the Q&A in full, on X, Threads and Reddit.
The questionnaire, seemingly filled out by the teenaged DiCaprio, reveals some illuminating facts about him, like his mother’s name, his dream car and how he used to play the organ.

Some of his favorites include singer Harry Connick Jr., Jack Nicholson, Meg Ryan and old “Twilight Zone” episodes. And, near the bottom, clear as day, his very favorite food is indeed listed as  “pasta, pasta and more pasta.”
What kind of pasta he prefers is still a mystery, but he has been  spotted eating spaghetti.
People online loved the blast-from-the-past fact sheet.
“Omg! I wonder if ‘Can’t touch this’ is still his favourite song?” one Threads user wrote.

“He like many of us during that time was also interested in Oceanography and would’ve liked being a Marine Biologist,” one user wrote, to whom another replied, “Hmmm. And this dream turned into a nightmare in Titanic.”
“pretty cool that he got to work with his favorite actor Jack Nicholson,” a Reddit user wrote, referring to the 2006 movie “The Departed.”

title: Noah Wyle Puts His Golden Globe Beside the Real Award, a Homemade ‘Best Dad’ Trophy
summary: Noah Wyle celebrated his Golden Globe Award win by sharing a photo of the trophy beside a handmade "best dad" award.
story: Noah Wyle had a great Golden Globes night.
“The Pitt” leading man took home the award for best TV male actor — drama, calling it a “truly humbling moment” during his acceptance speech.
This marked the 54-year-old actor's first Golden Globe, but that night he also nabbed a second award that just might be a touch more special.
On Jan. 12, a day after the awards show, Wyle shared a photo of his Golden Globe alongside a handmade “best dad” trophy made out of tin foil.
“What an incredible night. My heart is full,” the actor captioned the Instagram post.
Wyle shares son Owen, 24, and daughter Auden, 20, with his ex-wife, Tracy Warbin, and daughter Frances, 10, with his wife, Sara Wyle.
The former “ER” star attended the Globes with Sara Wyle, whom he gave a shoutout to during his speech.
“I’ve been supported by an incredible wife and three great children all along the way,” he said.
His daughter Auden Wyle praised him on her Instagram story after his win, writing, “The most dedicated father, human, artist and advocate.”
“My first inspiration and the greatest best friend. It is the biggest gift in the world to watch you shine,” she continues. “We love you so much.”
Last year, after winning two Emmys for "The Pitt," he told People that it's "really beautiful" to share the success with his family.

“To see my kids be proud of me and to have this be meaningful for them, for me, it has been really amazing,” he told the magazine in September 2025. “You always hope your kids know how hard you work. You always hope your kids know how much of yourself you fit into what you do by example for them.”
Adding, “This last year, I’ve really felt that they’ve been listening and watching and it’s been impactful.”

title: Leonardo DiCaprio Created '100 Memes in 30 Seconds' During Golden Globes Commercial Break That Went Viral
summary: Leonardo DiCaprio went viral for his facial expressions during a commercial break at the Golden Globes. See the moment.
story: Leonardo DiCaprio showed a playful side of himself at the 2026 Golden Globes.

During a commercial break, the "One Battle After Another" actor was seen speaking to someone nearby, who wasn't shown on-camera. During the interaction, which was captured without audio, DiCaprio was seen smiling, mouthing words and making hand gestures.

In the comments of a TikTok shared by the Golden Globes, a fan joked that DiCaprio "created (a) hundred memes in 30sec" in the video. Many said the clip reminded them of the actor's viral "Django Unchained" meme where his character laughs while taking a sip of wine.
The clip showed a new side to DiCaprio, fans said. "Leo in 'public' and leo in private such a different vibe ... he should open up more :))," a TikTok user wrote.
Others picked up on his animated facial expressions. Someone wrote, "Dude just showed his acting range while sitting on the table at the Globes 😂."

As for what he was saying? It remains a mystery — though people think, by lip reading, he referencing K-pop. The movie "KPOP Demon Hunters" won best original song for "Golden" and best animated feature.
"Translation — 'I was watching you with the K pop thing, you were like, who’s that, is that, Oh, K pop,'" a fan guessed.

At the 2026 Golden Globes, DiCaprio was nominated in the category of best actor in a movie (comedy or musical) for his work in "One Battle After Another." He ended up losing to Timothée Chalamet for his work in "Marty Supreme."
The "Wolf of Wall Street" actor also got roasted by host Nikki Glaser in her monologue, especially when she poked fun at DiCaprio's dating history.

“What a career you’ve had, countless iconic performances, you’ve worked with every great director, you’ve won three Golden Globes, an Oscar and the most impressive thing is you were able to accomplish all of that before your girlfriend turned 30,” Glaser joked.
She immediately apologized and explained why she felt she had to joke about it.

“Leo, I’m sorry I made that joke, it’s cheap, I tried not to,” Glaser said. “But we don’t know anything else about you, man. There’s nothing else ... I searched, the most in-depth interview you’ve ever given was in Teen Beat in 1991. Is your favorite food still ‘pasta, pasta and more pasta’?”
DiCaprio confirmed that it was.

title: ‘Heated Rivalry’ Author Rachel Reid Is Writing Another Book About Shane and Ilya
summary: See a synopsis and cover for "Unrivaled," a new book in Rachel Reid's "Game Changers" series that includes "Heated Rivalry."
story: Shane and Ilya’s story is set to continue on screen, with the breakout hockey romance “Heated Rivalry” renewed for Season 2. Now, their story will develop further on the page, too.

Rachel Reid, the author of “Heated Rivalry” and its sequel “The Long Game,” will release a third installment in the love story of hockey stars Shane Hollander and Ilya Rozanov, who begin as rivals before embarking on a yearslong affair.
Titled “Unrivaled,” the book promises to pick up right where “The Long Game” picks up.
(A warning for show fans: “The Long Game” may contain spoilers for the yet-to-be-filmed Season 2 of “Heated Rivalry.”)
Here’s what to know about “Unrivaled.”
When Is ‘Unrivaled’ Coming Out?
“Unrivaled,” by Rachel Reid, will come out Sept. 29, 2026. The romance novel will be published by Harlequin Books, a division of HarperCollins.
How to Pre-Order ‘Unrivaled’
“Unrivaled” is available for pre-order wherever books are sold, including the Harlequin website, Barnes & Noble, Books-A-Million and more.
🚨 Warning: The rest of this story contains spoilers about Shane and Ilya’s journey.
What Is ‘Unrivaled’ About?
“Unrivaled” will tell the next phase of Shane and Ilya’s story, which began with 2019’s “Heated Rivalry” and continued in 2022’s “The Long Game.”
Based on the synopsis for “Unrivaled,” the book will follow Shane and Ilya’s relationship as they navigate being out and facing discrimination from some sectors of the professional hockey world.
A line has been drawn—and the hockey world is divided.

For the first time in their professional hockey careers, Ilya Rozanov and Shane Hollander have nothing to hide. After more than a decade of keeping their love secret, they’re out, married, and even playing on the same team. The support has been incredible.
Most of the time.

While fans celebrate them, others in the hockey world are still reeling from the reveal. A growing backlash—led by the popular hockey podcast Top Shelf and the #TakeBackHockey movement—is making its presence felt.
Standing together in the light was everything Shane and Ilya ever wanted. Now, they may be facing their biggest challenge yet.
Wait, Shane and Ilya Are Married?
Yes!
Major spoilers ahead for the plot of Reid’s “The Long Game.”

“The Long Game” follows Shane and Ilya through their committed, yet hidden, relationship as they each navigate their hockey ambitions. Shane stays focused on the Stanley Cup while Ilya struggles with keeping their love secret and begins to reckon with his own mental health struggles.

After a blowout fight, a near plane crash, and of course, plenty of steamy scenes, Shane and Ilya get engaged. But their relationship is soon made public when they are seen kissing in the back of a viral video. As they deal with coming out not on their terms and against the wishes of the leaders of their hockey league, they decide to be open about their relationship.

And after facing discrimination from his longtime Montreal team, Shane ends up joining Ilya to play for the on-the-rise Ottawa pro team. The book ends with them about to start their first season playing on the same team.

title: The Best Dressed Stars of the 2026 Golden Globes, According to Fashion Experts
summary: See the best dressed looks from the 2026 Golden Globes. Fashion experts pick the best looks and explain why.
story: Maybe you watch the award show to find out who wins — or maybe you’re more interested in what they wore. At the 2026 Golden Globes, there was enough of both to keep you entertained either way.
According to stylist and designer June Ambrose, who appeared on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle on Jan. 12, the carpet felt “edgy and glamorous.”
“The girls and guys brought sexy back,” Ambrose said.
Obvious trends red carpet included a series of daring black dresses, worn by Teyana Taylor, Jenna Ortega and Sara Foster.
Jennifer Lawrence and Jennifer Lopez both opted for sheer fabrics, with Lawrence’s looking more earth and Lopez’s more flashy.

Bold colors made their way onto the red carpet, too, with Wunmi Mosaku, Rose Byrne and Laufey, among others, making a statement. Mosaku wrote in Vogue that she wore a yellow dress to announce her pregnancy thanks to a Yoruba phrase, “Mother is golden.”

During a Jan. 12 segment on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle, Ambrose, Zanna Roberts Rassi and Jenna Lyons shouted out their favorite picks. Fashion editor AK Brown and designer Hayley Paige also shared their standout looks with TODAY.com.
Below, find the Golden Globes outfits the experts loved this year and why.
Teyana Taylor

For the event, Taylor wore a custom Schiaparelli gown — which she showed off even further when she went on stage to collect her award. Zanna Roberts Rassi said Taylor didn't work with a stylist to create the work, but rather directly with designer D Rosebury.
Jennifer Lawrence
Ambrose said, during her appearance on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle, this dress "surprised" her the most. She likened the dress to Beyoncé's 2015 Met Gala look, where she wore a sheer gold gown.
Stylist Paige, in a statement to TODAY.com, said the dress "reflects an actor who understands nuance: confident, layered, and fully in control."
Selena Gomez

Selena Gomez, who walked the red carpet with her husband, Benny Blanco, went for an old Hollywood look. The “I Said I Love You First” singer wore a strapless Chanel gown that was embellished with white manmade feathers.
Rassi shared that Gomez’s look was very intentional. “Her stylist, Erin, told me it was created to represent exactly where Selena is at — ‘Joy meets elegance!’” she said.
“The glam was a slam!” Rassi added of Gomez’s look.
Timothée Chalamet
Chalamet sported a stunning velvet Chrome Hearts suit with a Cartier watch and a pair of Chrome Hearts x Timbaland boots.
According to Rassi, Chalamet looked very dapper like a “modern day Johnny Depp,” who was paying “homage to New York” with his footwear.
Ayo Edebiri
Edebiri opted for an off-the-shoulder, black velvet Chanel dress embellished with resin and pearl brooches.

According to Rassi, Edebiri's stylist had "gasped" when she first saw Edebiri's look on the runway. It was then she knew that her client would look great in the gown, so she sent it to "The Bear" actor, and she "loved" it.
Emily Blunt and John Krasinski
For the 2026 Golden Globes, Blunt wore a stunning Louis Vuitton gown, while her husband, John Krasinski, donned a dapper Dolce & Gabbana suit.
Rassi, on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle, called them the "best dressed couple in town," looking like a "modern day bride and groom."
Ambrose also spoke about the look and said "The Devil Wears Prada" actor looked like a modern Jackie Onassis, while Krasinski gave off a "smoky and sexy" vibe to him, likening him to Bruce Wayne.
Patrick Schwarzenegger
Of the "White Lotus" star's look, and daring accessories, Lyons said, "He really went there." He wore a Dolce & Gabbana suit paired with a broach, glasses and bowtie.
Rose Bryne
Byrne's emerald green dress took 210 hours to perfect, thanks to its 4,660 embroidered elements, including glass pearls and crystals, per Vogue. But what really stands out is the green hue.
“If you’re going to make the color the statement it has to be the perfect color,” Rassi said.
“Her stylist Kate told me they designed this dress in toile white then held up swatches of six different greens to get the perfect tone,” she continued.
Claire Danes
Rassi said that Danes had one of the “comfiest” and “cleverest” looks of the night. Her Zac Posen gown was inspired by a classic Gap T-shirt.
Walton Goggins
Ambrose shouted out Goggins’ outfit as her “wild card” choice. The “White Lotus” star wore a a gold lamé shirt under classic tailoring.
Of the look, Paige said, “The contrast between rigid suiting and fluid metallic fabric felt theatrical but controlled, confident, and slightly dangerous in the best way."
Colman Domingo
Paige said the combination of Colman Domingo’s black Valentino suit, plus the delicate appliqué along the lapel, is “proof that menswear’s most powerful statements are classic with a twist.”
Rei Ami
Rei Ami coordinated with the rest of the "KPOP Demon Hunters" singers in black dresses designed by Thom Browne and Valdrin Sahiti.
Paige said Rei Ami's black corset gown, designed by Sahiti, "leaned into femme-fatale energy, but with modern precision," adding, "This wasn’t about a role, it was about persona."
Kate Hudson
Hudson wore a vintage Armani gown from the company’s 2007 collection. However, the dress was given an update for the Golden Globes. The new version was more sheer and had new beading.
While speaking to Rassi, Hudson said her “toughest fashion critic” is Rani, her 7-year-old daughter, whom she shares with her fiancé, Danny Fujikawa.
Paige called Hudson an "art-deco goddess," but with "modern ease."
Renate Reinsve
Renate Reinsve, star of “Sentimental Value,” wore a dress with 800,000 beads, according to Vogue. The piece, designed by Nicolas Ghesquière, was a favorite with experts.
“I’m into this whole clean, shimmer, streamlined dress. Simple makeup, no jewels,” Lyons shared with TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle.
Brown was also a fan of Reinsve's look.

"The look was very calculated as it focused on texture, movement, and proportion without overdoing it. The dress was the statement — the lack of jewelry and even her hair were intentional to either move with the dress or to allow the dress to stand on its own," she told TODAY.com.
Kylie Jenner
Kylie Jenner didn’t walk the red carpet, but sat next to her boyfriend, Timothée Chalamet, who won best actor in a drama for “Marty Supreme.” She showed her gold gown in more detail on her Instagram.
Paige called the look by Ashi Studio "luminous, sculpted, and precise." The gown "mirrored the prestige-film gravitas of Timothée Chalamet’s moment with quiet, cinematic confidence," in her words.
Nikki Glaser
Nikki Glaser started the night off in a pink ballgown, then changed into a striking red dress for her opening monologue. Paige says the outfits helped solidify her as “ringleader” of the night.
“That opening red look was power dressing with a sense of humor: bold, confident and impossible to ignore without ever distracting from the show,” Paige said.
Skye P. Marshall
Marshall showed up at the Golden Globes in a breathtaking Lever Couture gown. Brown says Marshall’s look “promoted her radiance through movement."
Chase Infiniti

Infiniti made her debut at the Golden Globes a memorable one. The "One Battle After Another" star wore a Louis Vuitton dress that caught Brown's attention. Brown said Infiniti had "one of the most architecturally compelling pieces of the night."
Ginnifer Goodwin
Ginnifer Goodwin walked the red carpet in a long-sleeved black Armani gown adorned with pearls and Swarovski crystals. Brown called it the perfect balance of "drama" and "elegance."
Glen Powell
"Old-Hollywood codes, modern restraint," Paige said of Powell's look, designed by Brunello Cucinelli. She said the moment signaled "leading-man confidence without shouting for attention."
Even the glasses mattered: charm, but of course, with intellect," she continued.
Sara Foster
Paige says Foster’s look was “restrained, editorial, and self-possessed,” reading as “creative authority” — fitting for her role as the creator of Netflix’s “Nobody Wants This.”

title: Jenna & Sheinelle Debut Their New Theme Song by an Artist They Both Adore
summary: TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle debuted its new theme song by artist Blessing Offor.
story: TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle is here — and there’s some feel-good music to welcome everyone to the party!
Jenna Bush Hager and Sheinelle Jones walked onto their set in Studio 1A on Jan. 12 for their first show together to a new theme song that got the pair moving and smiling.
“Can we hear that song again?” Sheinelle asked after the duo sat down. “Can we crank it up?”
Revisit all the fun from Jenna & Sheinelle’s first show.
“Let’s hear it,” Jenna said.
The new co-hosts then started dancing to the upbeat ditty, while Sheinelle invited everyone in the studio to dance with them.

“By the way, can we thank our dear friend Blessing Offor who wrote that song just for us?” Jenna said about the new theme. “He’s an amazing friend — and we have a whole story behind it — but the fact that he would give his time for us means so much.”

Before Sheinelle could get into how she was handling her first day on the job, she had to circle back to the theme song. Sheinelle started by sharing that Jenna had sent her a tune by Blessing, called “Brighter Days,” when she was feeling “really low” one day while filling in as a guest co-host on TODAY with Jenna & Friends.
“And the fact that now, who would’ve thunk — (him) singing the theme song with our names in it for this show is nuts! Nuts!” Sheinelle said while energetically tapping her fingers on her desk.
In December, Sheinelle was named co-host of TODAY’s fourth hour after Jenna’s year-long search for a desk mate. Jenna had sat with more than 60 guest co-hosts last year on TODAY with Jenna & Friends.

“You all know her, she’s an extraordinary broadcaster, but more importantly, she exemplifies exactly what this show is all about,” Jenna said on TODAY with Jenna & Friends while introducing Sheinelle.
“To have a show like this is beyond my wildest dreams,” Sheinelle said. “This is the real deal, and I get to do it with Jenna.”

title: EXCLUSIVE: Mary J. Blige Announces Las Vegas Residency. How to Get Tickets
summary: Mary J. Blige will headline her first Las Vegas residency, with dates in May and July, it she revealed exclusively on TODAY.
story: Mary J. Blige will headline her first Las Vegas residency, the R&B icon revealed Jan. 12 on TODAY.
“Mary J. Blige: My Life, My Story The Las Vegas Residency” will kick off May 1 at Dolby Live at Park MGM. There will be five shows in May and another five in July.
“That’s major for me,” she told Craig Melvin live on TODAY. “Vegas is the big time.”
She explained the dynamics of the show and how it will be more of a storytelling experience.

“It’s going to be done more theatrical,” she said. “It’s still going to have the music, it’s still going to be fun — but it’s a story so there’s going to be actors and actresses. So the music tells the story. I have so many songs I haven’t performed yet for my fans. ... The actors are going to narrate the music.”
Interested in catching Blige in Sin City? Read on for more information.

title: What Nikki Glaser Said In Her 2026 Golden Globes Monologue
summary: Nikki Glaser kept the jokes and the jabs coming at the 2026 Golden Globes
story: Nikki Glaser kept the jokes and the jabs coming at the 2026 Golden Globes.
The comedian returned to host the annual awards ceremony, live from the Beverly Hilton in Los Angeles on Jan. 11.

Glaser made history last year as the first woman to host the Globes solo, and proved that she was more than ready to tackle the big gig. Ahead of this year's Golden Globes, she told TODAY.com, "I’m working with all of the same people. I’m going to all the same clubs to work on the material. I am thinking about the celebrity’s point of view."
When her moment arrived, Glaser appeared on the stage in an off-the-shoulder red gown, a quick wardrobe change from her pink red carpet look, as Taylor Swift's "Style" blasted in the background.
Read on for a full recap of Glaser's 2026 Golden Globes monologue.
What Did Nikki Glaser Say in Her Opening Monologue?
Glaser made her way through most of the nominees, poking fun at many of the stars — and herself.
Here are some of the highlights:

"Just like 'Frankenstein,' I've been pieced together by an unlicensed European surgeon and good work." "There's so many A-listers — and by A-listers, I do mean people who are on a list that has been heavily redacted." "The award for most editing goes to CBS News. Yes, CBS News, America's newest place to see BS news.""George Clooney is nominated tonight for the movie 'Jay Kelly.' Yes, where he plays George Clooney. He was so good.""Kevin Hart is here. Yes, The Rock's plus one-half...Kevin, you're so funny, and you and The Rock together are like my favorite comedy duo. You're, like, a Steve Martin and Martin Short, but for, like, people under 50 IQ." "How good was Leo in 'One Battle'? It is insane. So good, so vaping good. What a career you've had. I mean, countless iconic performances. You've worked with every great director. You've won three Golden Globes, an Oscar. And the most impressive thing is that you were able to accomplish all of that before your girlfriend turned 30. "You know, everyone in this town is obsessed with looking younger. Meanwhile, Sean Penn is like, 'What if I slowly morph into a sexy leather handbag?'""I can't believe it. We got two Michael B. Jordans. When I saw that, I was like, 'Nikki be jerking, because that was awesome.'" "Timothée Chalamet is the first actor in history who had to put on muscle for a movie about ping pong. He gained over 60 ounces. It's insane. "
"Just like 'Frankenstein,' I've been pieced together by an unlicensed European surgeon and good work."
"There's so many A-listers — and by A-listers, I do mean people who are on a list that has been heavily redacted."
"The award for most editing goes to CBS News. Yes, CBS News, America's newest place to see BS news."
"George Clooney is nominated tonight for the movie 'Jay Kelly.' Yes, where he plays George Clooney. He was so good."

"Kevin Hart is here. Yes, The Rock's plus one-half...Kevin, you're so funny, and you and The Rock together are like my favorite comedy duo. You're, like, a Steve Martin and Martin Short, but for, like, people under 50 IQ."

"How good was Leo in 'One Battle'? It is insane. So good, so vaping good. What a career you've had. I mean, countless iconic performances. You've worked with every great director. You've won three Golden Globes, an Oscar. And the most impressive thing is that you were able to accomplish all of that before your girlfriend turned 30.
"You know, everyone in this town is obsessed with looking younger. Meanwhile, Sean Penn is like, 'What if I slowly morph into a sexy leather handbag?'"
"I can't believe it. We got two Michael B. Jordans. When I saw that, I was like, 'Nikki be jerking, because that was awesome.'"
"Timothée Chalamet is the first actor in history who had to put on muscle for a movie about ping pong. He gained over 60 ounces. It's insane. "
Reactions to Nikki Glaser’s Opening Monologue
So far, Glaser has received overwhelmingly positive reactions on social media to her monologue.
"Truly, why doesn’t Nikki Glaser host every awards show? She’s absolutely killing this monologue right now," one X user asked.

"Nikki Glaser didn’t repeat herself," another said. "She raised the bar. One year after redefining what a Golden Globes host could be, she came back and delivered one of the sharpest, most assured opening monologues the show has had in a decade. At this point, it isn’t a gamble. It’s a standard."
A third X user said, "Nikki Glaser roasting CBS on CBS is iconic."
"Few things will make me change the channel from the NFL playoffs, but a Nikki Glaser opening monologue at the Golden Globes will," one person tweeted.

title: How to Watch the 2026 Golden Globes on TV, Online — And For Free
summary: Find everything you need to know to watch the 2026 Golden Globes on Sunday, January 11. See what time it starts, what channel it's on, and how to stream it live.
story: The 2026 award season has officially begun, kicking off with the 83rd annual Golden Globes on Sunday, Jan 11.
The ceremony, hosted by Nikki Glaser for the second year in a row, is promised to be a star-studded event, with Hollywood greats attending one of the entertainment industry’s big nights.

Only at the Golden Globes could Leonardo DiCaprio, nominated for “One Battle After Another,” mingle with the cast of Season 3 of “The White Lotus.” Other nominees across film and TV include Michael B. Jordan for “Sinners,” Timothée Chalamet for “Marty Supreme” and Emma Stone for “Bugonia.”
Prior to the ceremony starting, there will be a series of red carpet pre-shows.
Continue reading to learn more about how to tune in to the ceremony, and follow along for live updates on the Golden Globes here.
What Time Do the 2026 Golden Globes Start?
The ceremony starts at 8 p.m. ET / 5 p.m. PT.
What Channel Is the 2026 Golden Globes On?
The Golden Globes will air live on CBS.
Those without a cable subscription can access the Golden Globes through subscriptions to DirectTV Live, Hulu + Live TV, Sling TV and Fubo, many of which offer a free trial.
Where Is the 2026 Golden Globes Streaming?
The Golden Globes can be streamed live through:
Paramount+ with ShowtimeCBS.com with a cable subscription
Paramount+ with Showtime
CBS.com with a cable subscription
Who Is Hosting the 2026 Golden Globes?
Comedian Nikki Glaser will return to host the Golden Globes for the second year in a row after her performance last year was incredibly well-received.

“Usually, you do something and there’s a couple of people who don’t like what you did — or a couple flaws you can find — and it was universally appreciated and well-reviewed. I’m not used to that,” Glaser told The Hollywood Reporter of hosting last year’s Golden Globes ceremony.

She continued, “But I just went back and watched it two days ago just to remind myself of what I liked, what I didn’t like. Well, damn, I kind of nailed it. And it scares me, because that was kind of lightning in a bottle. I got really lucky with some of the nominees. Everything worked out. So it’s a high bar. I’m kind of screwed.”

title: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen's Relationship Timeline
summary: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen have been linked since 2023. Here's what to know about their relationship timeline including when they first met.
story: Hailee Steinfeld found her perfect match in Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen.

Both Allen and Steinfeld had a busy Jan. 11. Hours before Steinfeld was set to present an award at the Golden Globes, Allen and the Bills won their AFC Wild Card playoff game against the Jacksonville Jaguars.

The "Sinners" star and the quarterback are at the top of their respective games, and they're building an empire together. Here's what to know about Allen and Steinfeld's relationship — and the family that they're growing.
August 2023: Josh Allen Publicly Addresses Relationship for the 1st Time
Months are the pair were first spotted together on a night out in New York in May 2023, Allen addressed the relationship.

During an appearance on the "Pardon My Take" podcast in August 2023, co-host Dan Katz asked Allen about his relationship with Steinfeld. After initially avoiding the question, he eventually referenced their relationship.
The hosts asked about Allen's trip to Mexico in July of that year, where paparazzi had taken and published intimate photographs of him and Steinfeld kissing.
"I saw it and I just like felt this gross feeling," Allen said on the podcast."Insecurity. No privacy. It was just like, 'What is wrong with these people?'"
Allen explained that the paparazzi hid on a boat in order to snap the pictures.
October 2023: Steinfeld Supports the Buffalo Bills
Steinfeld cheered on the Buffalo Bills at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in London during their match the Jacksonville Jaguars.
January 2024: Steinfeld Shuts Down Engagement Accusations
At the 2024 Golden Globes awards, Steinfeld wore an elegant diamond ring on her right hand to the ceremony, sparking rumors that Allen had proposed.
When asked about the ring, Steinfeld shut down the rumors.
"No particular reason other than I just thought it was real cute," Steinfeld told E! News.
July 2024: Allen Hard Launches the Relationship
Allen officially announced his relationship status with Steinfeld in a post to Instagram.
The post featured a carousel of pictures from his summer, with several photos of Steinfeld. The post was caption "Onward 🤘🏼", and showed Steinfeld with the Allen family.
October 2024: Steinfeld and Allen Co-Host a Halloween Party
Steinfeld and Allen hosted a Halloween celebration for the Buffalo Bills players and their partners to attend. The event was circus themed, and Steinfeld and Allen dressed up as the ring masters.
November 2024: An Engagement Is Announced
At the end of November 2024, Allen proposed to Steinfeld on a ledge overlooking the waterfront as the sun was setting. The pair shared a picture from the day through a joint Instagram post.
February 2025: She Gets a Shoutout in a Speech

At the 2025 NFL Honors awards, Steinfeld and Allen shared their relationship by appearing on the red carpet together. It was an exciting night for Allen because he won the Most Valuable Player (MVP) award at the end of the night.
When accepting the award, Allen thanked Steinfeld in his speech.
"My fiancé Hailee, you are my rock. You are my best friend. I would not be standing on this stage if it were not for you."
May 2025: They Get Married in California
In a private ceremony held in Santa Barbara, California, the couple tied the knot after over two years together. Steinfeld wore a simple strapless dress paired with long white gloves and a veil.
Steinfeld posted a collage of Polaroid photos to her Instagram with the caption "HUSBAND!"

She wrote about her wedding on her Beau Society newsletter. Among the details? She said she "never more like myself and more beautiful" than she did in her wedding dress, designed by Tamara Ralph. Instead of a bouquet, she said she carried a single crystal flower.
June 2025: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen Honeymoon
The newlyweds went on a tropical vacation to celebrate their honeymoon. Allen posted a collection of photos from the trip with the caption "Wifey ❤️" to Instagram.
December 2025: Hailee Steinfeld Announces She's Expecting
Steinfeld and Allen announced they are expecting their first child together. The pair made the announcement through a video of Allen kissing her baby bump posted to social media.

title: How to Watch the Golden Globes Red Carpet and See All the Best-Dressed Stars
summary: Here's how to watch the Golden Globes red carpet and pre-show on Sunday. Find out what time it starts, what channel it's on, and where to stream it online.
story: Fans are not only tuning in to the Golden Globes to see who wins best actor and best actress, but also to see who takes home the title of best dressed.

Stars from this year's most popular films and television series will walk the red carpet on Jan. 11 at The Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, California ahead of the 83rd annual Golden Globes, hosted this year by comedian Nikki Glaser.
Nominees include Kate Hudson ("Song Sung Blue"), Emma Stone ("Bugonia"), Timothée Chalamet ("Marty Supreme"), George Clooney ("Jay Kelly"), Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande ("Wicked: For Good").
Continue reading to find out how to watch this year's Golden Globes red carpet.
How to Watch the Golden Globes Red Carpet
E!'s red carpet coverage starts at 6 p.m. ET / 3 p.m. PT and is hosted by Zuri Hall, Justin Sylvester and Keltie Knight. You can watch it in the following places:
E! and USA NetworksUSANetwork.comE! and USA apps on iOS, Android mobile and Apple TV devices
E! and USA Networks
USANetwork.com
E! and USA apps on iOS, Android mobile and Apple TV devices
It will be available to stream next day on Peacock.
ET: Live on the Golden Globes Red Carpet starts at 7 p.m. ET / 4 p.m. PT with Kevin Frazier and Michelle Turner.

Variety’s digital pre-show will be hosted by journalists Angelique Jackson and Marc Malkin. It will stream live starting at 6:30 p.m. ET / 3:30 p.m. PT on variety.com, Variety’s YouTube channel and Fire TV.
The Hollywood Reporter and Spotify are collaborating to bring their own Golden Globes red carpet coverage, hosted by Kareem Rahma, creator of Subway Talks.
Follow along on The Hollywood Reporter and Spotify’s social media platforms, as well as THR.com.
How to Watch the Golden Globes
The 83rd annual Golden Globes is live on CBS, and streaming on CBS.com and Paramount+ with Showtime and CBS.com, on Sunday, Jan. 11 at 8 p.m. ET / 5 p.m. PT.

title: Ken Jeong Reveals Easter Eggs in ‘The Hangover’ Meant Just for His Wife
summary: When Ken Jeong filmed "The Hangover," he was thinking about his wife."I view maybe the raunchiest, dirtiest movie I’ve ever been a part of, like, the most warm set behind the scenes," he said on Sunday Sitdown Jan.
story: When Ken Jeong filmed "The Hangover," he was thinking about his wife.
"I view maybe the raunchiest, dirtiest movie I’ve ever been a part of, like, the most warm set behind the scenes," he said on Sunday Sitdown Jan. 11.

Jeong's wife, Tran, was diagnosed with breast cancer before filming began on the cult classic movie. To try and lift her spirits while she underwent chemotherapy, Jeong said he placed a few Easter eggs in the film to make his wife laugh.

"I’m Korean and she’s Vietnamese and so there was so much nonsense in Mr. Chow," he told Willie Geist about his memorable character. "I would literally just speak gibberish in Vietnamese to make her laugh. I didn’t tell anybody."

Re-enacting what he would say, he added, "It sounds like, 'Release the hostage,' you know? And in Vietnamese, it means, 'chicken thigh.' ... So there’s all these little Easter eggs in the movie that make me and Tran laugh."
Ho has been cancer-free for 18 years. When her husband filmed "The Hangover," he was around 40 years old and didn't know how big the movie would become.
He said people still stop him on the street to recite one of his most notable lines from the film: "Toodle-oo, motherf-----."
"I was at an ATM one day, and this guy in a convertible just stops and just stares at me. And when the light goes green he goes, “Toodle-oo, motherf-----" Jeong laughs. "Just drives away."
"That's my legacy," he added.
In addition to "The Hangover," Jeong joined the cast of NBC's "Community" and went on to appear in other great movies, such as "Crazy Rich Asians" and "Transformers: Dark of the Moon."
Fans can also catch him judging the celebrity competition series "The Masked Singer," which Jeong joked he has no business being a part of.

"I have nothing to do with the music business. And (that's coming) from a guy considered to be one of the smartest people in the business because of my medical background. It is so fitting that I am the dumbest person on that show," he said with a laugh.
Jeong explained that he does his best to provide comedic relief when it's time to guess which singer is behind the mask.

"That’s where the comedy comes in," he says. "I will just do my best enlightened idiot kind of point of view and say, 'I know exactly who that is.' So if I say that, I have no idea and I’m panicking deep, down inside."

title: Buying Greenland could cost as much as $700 billion
summary: WASHINGTON — The United States could have to pay as much as $700 billion if it were to achieve President Donald Trump’s goal of buying Greenland, according to three people familiar with the cost estimate
story: WASHINGTON — The United States could have to pay as much as $700 billion if it were to achieve President Donald Trump’s goal of buying Greenland, according to three people familiar with the cost estimate.

The estimate was generated by scholars and former U.S. officials as part of planning around Trump’s aspiration to acquire the 800,000-square-mile island as a strategic buffer in the Arctic against America’s top adversaries, these people said. It attaches a price tag of more than half the Defense Department’s annual budget to Trump’s national security priority, which has stoked anxiety across Europe and on Capitol Hill amid his rhetoric about seizing Greenland since he ordered a U.S. military raid to capture Venezuela’s president and his wife.

Greenland, the semi-autonomous territory of the kingdom of Denmark, is not for sale. Officials from Denmark and Greenland have rejected Trump’s claims that the U.S. will acquire Greenland “one way or the other.” A senior White House official, however, said Secretary of State Marco Rubio has been directed to come up with a proposal in the coming weeks to purchase Greenland, describing such a plan as a “high priority” for Trump.

On Wednesday, Rubio and Vice President JD Vance are scheduled to meet with officials from Denmark and Greenland, who traveled to Washington seeking a better understanding of Trump’s intentions and proposals. The meeting follows lower-level discussions last week between officials from Denmark and Greenland and the White House National Security Council.

“I’d love to make a deal with them,” Trump told reporters Sunday when he was asked whether there is a deal Greenland could offer. “It’s easier. But one way or the other, we’re going to have Greenland.”
In the hours before Wednesday’s meetings, the message from Greenland’s government was consistent.

“Greenland does not want to be owned by, governed by or part of the United States,” Foreign Minister Vivian Motzfeldt said as she arrived in Washington on Tuesday. “We choose the Greenland we know today — as part of the Kingdom of Denmark.”

title: 'It's horrifying': Videos of body bags and machine guns give rare glimpse of Iran's bloody crackdown
summary: Videos of body bags and machine guns that have trickled out of the Iran offer a rare glimpse into the scope of the crackdown on protests.
story: One man is covered with a bloody white shroud inside a body bag. Another lies nearby, his body sprawled on the tiled floor with arms raised and blood streaked across the face.
Row upon row of other bodies surround them.
“It’s horrifying. It’s the apocalypse,” says the man filming the scene in the warehouse of a forensics center near Tehran. “There are lots of bodies.”

Iran has been largely shut off from the rest of the world for days, since its regime cut the internet and severely restricted phone access after cities across the country erupted in anger sparked by the crash of the currency against the U.S. dollar and soaring inflation. Videos that have trickled out and circulated online offer a window into the resulting crackdown in the Islamic Republic and the methods employed by security forces to quell the unrest.

The images, circulated on social media this week and geolocated by NBC News, show more than 200 bodies piled in the makeshift morgue outside the capital, machine guns fired at crowds, and clashes in cities from Urmia in the northwest to Isfahan in the heart of the country.
At least 2,500 people have been killed, according to the the U.S.-based Human Rights Activists News Agency. Authorities have not given an official death toll.

Most tallies placed the number of protesters killed before the internet blackout Thursday at around 40, with rights groups and activists suggesting that Thursday and Friday nights saw the crackdown intensify into scenes not witnessed in the country for decades.
Two videos from Tehran, which circulated online Monday, show the tactics employed by security forces.

In one, a man wearing a helmet with a visor can be seen firing a machine gun at a crowd of people about 30 yards away across a square. The muzzle of the machine gun flares in the night as the man sprays automatic fire.

In another, shots ring out near a police station as protesters can be heard chanting, “Death to Khamenei,” a reference to the Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, the highest authority in the country. As the crowd chants largely out of sight, heavy automatic gunfire can be heard for 15 uninterrupted seconds.

A group of security forces then comes into view from the right side of the screen and a member of the security forces aims and fires a pistol. A short while later, a person or body is dragged into the police station, though it is not clear who this person is. Several members of the security forces in riot gear on motorcycles then drive into the police station.
About 5 miles south of the capital's southern suburbs, the Kahrizak Forensic Medical Center has offered perhaps the clearest sign of the crackdown's intensity.
Videos from the site, which became a makeshift morgue, first circulated over the weekend. Two more separate videos, which appear to have been shot by one person, circulated Tuesday.

Outside the warehouse, the man filming the scene at Kahrizak walks up to a woman in a lab coat with a black headscarf who is writing in a notebook next to a man's blood-soaked body. The body has been partially removed from a black body bag placed on dirt.
A man in a black T-shirt and black pants wearing gloves holds the body on its side and positions the bloody head for the medical official to get a better glimpse at the wound.
“Was he hit in the head?” the person filming asks. Another man nearby replies: “Yes.”
The same woman, whom one man calls doctor, walks up to the back of an ambulance and asks why a body is still in the vehicle.
“Because there was no more space left on the ground,” a man replies, his voice cracking. “It’s a woman, it’s my sister.”

Nearby, a man in a blue medical smock and orange gloves examines the head of a man’s body that is stripped down to white underwear and pulled out of a black covering. “They hit him from behind,” a man says, as another person nearby can be heard sobbing.

title: Why Trump's Venezuela raid may not stop China's influence in South America
summary: HONG KONG — With the surprise capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, President Donald Trump declared U.S. authority over the entire Western Hemisphere — and warned China that it’s not welcome in America’s backyard
story: HONG KONG — With the surprise capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, President Donald Trump declared U.S. authority over the entire Western Hemisphere — and warned China that it’s not welcome in America’s backyard.

Trump administration officials have cited the need to counter China’s growing influence in the region as a justification for the attack on Venezuela, which counts the country as its biggest customer for oil.
“We’re not going to allow the Western Hemisphere to be a base of operation for adversaries, competitors and rivals of the United States,” Secretary of State Marco Rubio told NBC News this week.

Experts say China, the world’s second-largest economy, is not likely to be dislodged from Latin America, where it has been investing and cultivating ties for more than 20 years as U.S. attention was focused elsewhere.

Though the Trump administration has reportedly ordered Venezuela to sever economic ties with Beijing, Energy Secretary Chris Wright told Fox News on Thursday that the U.S. was “not going to cut off China” from Venezuelan oil, and the country would continue to buy it, “just like the rest of the world.”
China is far from dependent on Venezuela for oil. While Beijing buys the majority of Venezuela’s crude oil exports, they make up only a single-digit percentage of all Chinese oil purchases.

Nonetheless, Beijing has strongly condemned the U.S. strike on Venezuela and its claims to the country’s oil, saying, “The legitimate rights and interests of China and other countries in Venezuela must be protected.”

“The United States’ reckless use of force against Venezuela and its demand that Venezuela dispose of its oil resources under the principle of ‘America First’ constitute bullying behavior,” foreign ministry spokesperson Mao Ning said Wednesday.
Venezuela’s interim leader, Delcy Rodríguez, has welcomed the support, saying Thursday that she had met with Chinese Ambassador Lan Hu.

“We value China’s firm and consistent stance in strongly condemning the serious violation of international law and Venezuelan sovereignty,” Rodríguez said in a post on Telegram, according to Reuters, referring to the U.S. capture of Maduro.

Though Venezuela is China’s only “all-weather” strategic partner in Latin America, the relationship had deteriorated during Maduro’s 12-year rule, with bilateral trade and Chinese investment dropping off as Venezuela fell behind on billions in Chinese loan repayments and faltered on oil production.
Add NBC News to Google
Add NBC News to Google
China also has no security commitments to Venezuela, meaning its support was mostly rhetorical as U.S. military forces massed in the months leading up to Maduro’s capture.

Despite China’s investment interests, “I’m not sure they would want to be part of a conflict that, from the outside, doesn’t seem to involve them,” said Bárbara Fernández Melleda, an assistant professor of Latin American studies at the University of Hong Kong.

In the wider region, Beijing’s focus has also been mostly economic, and it overtook the U.S. as South America’s top trading partner in 2010. In its annual report on the Chinese military last month, the Pentagon said Beijing was expanding its influence in Latin America through “infrastructure and energy development, economic assistance, and trade.”

One of the splashiest projects is the Chancay port, a large deep-water port in Peru that opened in 2024 and “has put South America on the map in a big way,” said Carol Wise, a professor of international politics at the University of Southern California who specializes in Latin America.

title: Security fears and dreams of minerals behind Trump's push to 'own' Greenland, experts say
summary: To hear President Donald Trump tell it, a push to take control of Greenland is a “national security” necessity, critical to reinforcing control of the Arctic against possible threats from Russia and China
story: To hear President Donald Trump tell it, a push to take control of Greenland is a “national security” necessity, critical to reinforcing control of the Arctic against possible threats from Russia and China.

For America’s allies and Greenlanders themselves, however, Trump’s threats to seize the semi-autonomous Danish territory cut much deeper, and threaten to shatter the decades-old principle of Western defense cooperation.
But there may be little they can do to stop it.

“This is a threat that is completely appalling, to be honest,” Aaja Chemnitz, one of two Greenlandic lawmakers in the Danish parliament, said in an interview Thursday. “You can’t just buy another country, a people, the soul of Greenland,” she added.
“Everybody in Greenland is discussing it, and many people are worried and concerned.”
That alarm is shared across European capitals.

French President Emmanuel Macron accused the United States on Thursday of “breaking free from the international rules that it used to promote,” while German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier warned the world risked descending into a “den of robbers, where the most unscrupulous take whatever they want.”

Though it looms artificially large on a Mercator projection map, where it is stretched to the scale of Africa despite being 14 times smaller in size, Greenland has rarely figured so prominently in mainstream Western consciousness.

The vast island — around the size of Alaska and California combined — is inhabited by only 57,000 people, about the same as Carson City, Nevada. Around 90% of them are Indigenous Inuit people whose ancestors arrived more than 1,000 years ago.
Denmark colonized Greenland 300 years ago and granted it the status of an autonomous territory in the 1970s, while retaining control of military and foreign policy.

American designs on Greenland go back way further than Trump. In 1867, then-Secretary of State William H. Seward contemplated annexing Greenland, as well as Iceland, having recently bought Alaska from Russia.

The United States briefly took control of Greenland during World War II to stop it from being used by the Nazis, and an agreement has existed since 1951 that allows the U.S. to “construct, install, maintain, and operate” military bases across the island.

Greenland’s sole U.S. military base was used as an early detection post for Soviet nuclear missiles during the Cold War, home to thousands of troops at its peak. Locked in by ice for nine months of the year, the Pituffik base is now overseen by the U.S. Space Force and houses a much smaller number of troops.
When Trump first said he wanted to buy Greenland in 2019, in what he described as a “real estate deal,” it was widely seen internationally as absurd.
But after years of pressure from Trump, and the U.S. attack on Venezuela, few in Europe are laughing.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio will meet with the foreign ministers from Denmark and Greenland next week for further discussions, as officials push for a deal.

But the White House says that all options are on the table, including military action. An attack by NATO’s most powerful member on an ally would most likely implode the alliance, which for decades has upheld the principle of collective defense.

“We are going to do something on Greenland, whether they like it or not, because if we don’t do it, Russia or China will take over Greenland, and we’re not going to have Russia or China as a neighbor,” Trump told reporters at the White House on Friday.
“We’re not going to allow Russia or China to occupy Greenland, and that’s what’s going to happen if we don’t own it,” he said during the public portion of a meeting with oil and gas executives.

European powers including Britain, France and Germany said in a joint statement this week they “will not stop defending” the principles of territorial integrity, but most experts agree with White House deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller’s blunt assessment that “nobody’s going to fight the U.S. over the future of Greenland.”

The European Union could impose sanctions on Washington, or limit its use of military bases in Europe, but both would be mutually painful in the extreme, said Mika Aaltola, a Finnish lawmaker who serves on the European Union’s Foreign Affairs Committee.
“We are basically in a trap that is difficult to resolve,” Aaltola told NBC News.

“We thought that January would be about peace deals or a cease-fire in Ukraine,” he said, referring to diplomatic efforts between the U.S. and Europe to end that conflict. “But all of a sudden, we realized that Trump has manipulated us into a situation where he wants to have Greenland.”
Iain Duncan Smith, a veteran British lawmaker, said “the reality for Europe is they need to probably offer an alternative to the demand that Trump is making.”

There is bafflement alongside the dismay. Trump already has huge scope to build new military bases on Greenland or negotiate deals for its minerals, but he has refused to compromise on his demand for “ownership” to be transferred.
He said Friday: “When we own it, we defend it. You don’t defend leases the same way. You have to own it.”

Aside from being a good outpost from which to keep an eye on Russia, Greenland also forms one side of the “GIUK gap” (which stands for Greenland, Iceland, United Kingdom), a naval choke point for submarines and other vessels in and out of the Atlantic.
As the global ice sheet melts, new Arctic sea routes are emerging that Trump’s team and other Western officials fear could be exploited by China and Russia.

Beijing has certainly made moves in the region, declaring itself in 2019 to be a “near Arctic nation” and outlining plans for a “Polar silk road” to mirror the infrastructure belt it has constructed on land.

White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt pointed to this motive Wednesday, saying U.S. ownership of Greenland was required “to deter Russian and Chinese aggression in the Arctic region,” though she said there would be “many other benefits.”

Vice President JD Vance cited Greenland’s continued role in missile defense infrastructure in an interview with Fox News on Wednesday, criticizing what he said was a lack of investment from Denmark and Europe that left it vulnerable to potential threats from “the Russians and the Chinese.”
“They haven’t done a good job of securing that area, that land mass,” he said.
Denmark’s ambassador to the U.S., Jesper Møller Sørensen, said the country has recently invested $4 billion in Arctic security, including expanding the permanent presence of its armed forces.
